intro: Galium commune var. fleurotii, commonly known as the Fleurot's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive yet often overlooked member of the flora in its native habitats.
